item.title: By: brian
item.dc:creator: brian
item.description: Just a quick addition to the above. I think we stumbled across a world of confusion with the word 'work'. I'm sitting here typing this at work – is it 'work'? When I commute, am I working? Am I at work more on the bus than when I'm cycling? When I rush home to cook tea, is that work? When I help my kids with their homework, is that 'work'? But I don't think this confusion is (just) a result of our cack-handed presentation: there is a real blurring of the boundaries between 'work' and 'non-work'. And sometimes being at work is more like living while getting food for tea is closer to factory work…
